Technique: ENGOBE; FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; PAINTED
Name: Unguent vessel
Description: Truncate cone-shaped unguent vessel, with rounded rim, narrow neck and flat concave base. The body has a curvature in the bottom half and is decorated with a painted line in wine-red consisting of spirals which cover the entire body. Paste of a reddish colour and surface with coating of the same colour.
